Notes: Philiki Insurance specialises in general insurance.
It is a shareholder in associate company Interamerican Insurance, Euroinvestment and Finance, and Philoktimatiki.

Last year it acquired the general business portfolios of holding company Paneuropean, Interamerican and Zako Insurance. The cost of the acquisition, 4.5 million pounds, was written off in the 1996 accounts.
In the same year its life business portfolio was transferred to Interamerican.

Company chairman Nicos Shakolas announced Philiki plans to increase its share capital to 15 million ordinary shares with a nominal value of 50 cent from 10 million shares of 50 cent. It will also issue bonus shares at a ratio of one for every one held to shareholders registered on June 20th 1997.
EPS in respect of 1995 has been adjusted from 41.3 cents per share to 33.9 cents per share due to the issue of 1,773.750 new shares which took place in 1996.
